hints.content:
$\underbrace{\purpleD{\text{Area}}}_{\text{shaded figure }}=\underbrace{\blueE{\text{Area}}}_{\text{large rectangle }}-\underbrace{\maroonE{\text{Area}}}_{\text{small rectangle }}$

[[☃ image 1]]

The area of each rectangle equals the base times the height.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
Yes, a square is a type of rectangle that has all equal side lengths.

In this case, both the base and the height are $3$ centimeters long.
options.showPrompt: Wasn't the cut out part a square?

options.alt: A large rectangle with a small rectangle set inside it.  The lines of the small rectangle are dashed to show it is being removed. The large rectangle has a base of 7 centimeters and a height of 6 centimeters. The small rectangle has a base of 3 centimeters and a height of 3 centimeters. !
A rectangle that has a base of 7 centimeters and a height of 6 centimeters. !
A rectangle that has a base of 3 centimeters and a height of 3 centimeters. !

hints.content: The remaining area is $33$ square centimeters.

question.content:
A large rectangle has side lengths of $7$ centimeters and $6$ centimeters.

A small square with side lengths of $3$ centimeters is cut out of the large rectangle.

[[☃ image 1]]

**What is the area of the remaining part of the large rectangle?**

[[☃ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ square cm}$

options.alt: An 8-sided figure in the shape of a large rectangle with a small rectangle cut out from the top. The large rectangle has a base of 7 centimeters and a height of 6 centimeters. The space removed by the small rectangle has a base of 3 centimeters and a height of 3 centimeters. !
